en: Pre-Alpha refers to all activities performed during the software project before formal testing.
Alpha is the first phase to begin software testing
Beta generally begins when the software is feature complete but likely to contain a number of known or unknown bugs.

Perpetual-Beta where new features are continually added to the software without establishing a final 'stable' release. This technique may allow a developer to delay offering full support and responsibility for remaining issues.
Open-Beta is for a larger group, or anyone interested.
Closed-Beta is released to a restricted group of individuals for a user test by invitation.
Release-Candidate also known as 'going silver', is a beta version with potential to be a stable product, which is ready to release unless significant bugs emerge
Stable-Release Also called production release, the stable release is the last release candidate (RC) which has passed all verifications / tests.
End-Of-Life indicate no longer supported and continue its existence until to ExpiryDate!
fa: Alpha is the first phase to begin software testing
